variables.name: CidrIp
variables.required: Conditional. Cannot be used when specifying a destination security             group.

variables.description: Specifies the group ID of the destination Amazon VPC security group.
variables.name: DestinationSecurityGroupId
variables.required: Conditional. Cannot be used when specifying a CIDR IP             address.

variables.description: Start of port range for the TCP and UDP protocols, or an ICMP type number. If                   you specify icmp for the IpProtocol property, you can                   specify -1 as a wildcard (i.e., any ICMP type number).
variables.name: FromPort

variables.description: ID of the Amazon VPC security group to modify. This value can be a reference to an AWS::EC2::SecurityGroup resource that has a                   valid VpcId property or the ID of an existing Amazon VPC security group.
variables.name: GroupId

variables.description: IP protocol name or number. For valid values, see the IpProtocol parameter in AuthorizeSecurityGroupIngress
variables.name: IpProtocol

variables.description: End of port range for the TCP and UDP protocols, or an ICMP code. If you                   specify icmp for the IpProtocol property, you can                   specify -1 as a wildcard (i.e., any ICMP code).
variables.name: ToPort
